snippet: The presidential candidate asked his supporters for more time to decide the right course of action as Secretary of State John Kerry prepared to travel to Afghanistan in response to the crisis.
abstract: Abdullah Abdullah, trailing rival Ashraf Ghani in latest vote tally of Afghanistan's presidential runoff election, asks his supporters for more time to decide the right course of action; Abdullah's supporters are urging him to form a breakaway government, saying election has been rigged.

byline.contributor: Haris Kakar, Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The presidential candidate asked his supporters for more time to decide the right course of action as Secretary of State John Kerry prepared to travel to Afghanistan in response to the crisis.

headline.main: Afghan Candidate Stops Short of Forming Government
headline.print_headline: Afghan Candidate Stops Short of Forming Government
